185899810.review: Es hermoso, divertido y seria perfecto si te pudieras agarrar a la herrera

185894893.review:
I had an absolutely fantastic time with this game, and it might just be one of my favorites. From the combat that felt fun to the surprisingly emotional story that had some good humor, it was phenomenal. If you're unsure about buying this game for the full price, I got the game when it went on sale for around $4. This game packs plenty of content in a $15 package for you to enjoy and you better believe I did.

For people curious about this game, I'd actually recommend going in blind for the story. This comes with the benefit (or drawback depending on how you look at it emotionally) of the jokes and emotional bits hitting much harder. 

To end things off, my favorite character in this game is easily Fidget.

I absolutely hope this game gets a sequel, it deserves it.

185151395.review:
In one sentence:

Somewhat generic, but still entertaining rpg platformer with some metroidvania elements.

Heads:

The voice acting for this game is on-point and really cool to see. I think it’s one of this game’s best aspects. The characters are well written.

The “traditional-animation” / hand drawn graphics for everything is also really cool and unique. The animated background critters are cool to look at, and I really like the weather cycles.

The fact that this was also fully created by one person (Dean Dodrill) is really cool. It doesn’t contribute to the gameplay, but it does make me appreciate the game more.

Tails (heh):

While the voice acting / dialogue is really good, it does also feel really cheesy and over-dramatic at times. Feels like the way they talk in anime. More of a personal-taste thing, but I found it a little hard to listen to at times. While the characters are interesting, I feel like some of them could have seen a return in the late game. As it is, once you finish business with a character, you never really see them again.

I appreciate that there are multiple combos in order to perform special attacks, however I feel that they are usually only useful against singular enemies, which occurs somewhat rarely.

I was also a little bummed that there wasn’t anything to gain by 100%ing everything, even if just a random tidbit of dialogue.

184812297.review: Yeah - it's ok, but nothing brilliant.

184788601.review: I had fun with this game, once upon a time. It tries so many things and nearly succeeds, but never quite manages to be great. Solid work for a solo developer, but hard to replay now.

184708349.review: Fun platformer/beat-em-up.  The sidekick is kind of annoying but overall the game is good.

184654001.review:
For a game from more than a decade ago, it holds up surprisingly well!
The story itself feels slightly cliche, but despite that, main character and his sidekick are a joy to listen to. I love Fidget's personality :D and Dust is pretty cool as well. I've expected him to be a typical edgy character, but I was pleasantly surprised. The two have some funny banter going on.

The game is quite pretty, too. Maybe it's not Ori/Hollow Knight level of pretty, but it still has its charm. Not to mention it's obviously made by fans of furry media <3

Combat is not too difficult (I've played on Normal difficulty). It's pretty easy to reach a point where one could just cheese through almost all fights. Honestly, I had more difficulty with platforming rather than combat; although platforming isn't that difficult either.

Exploring in this game feels nice. It has some "metroidvania" elements, where you are encouraged to re-visit previous maps after unlocking new ways of dealing with obstacles. It offers enough things to find to keep me entertained, while also not being overwhelming.

Finishing the entire story and finding all secrets has taken me 14 hours,

184511061.review:
Beautiful and fun. Art, sound design, voice acting, and controls are all top notch.

It really doesn't just look and sound amazing, but the crisp controls make you feel like it's YOU fighting and moving. That makes the challenges fun instead of frustrating. I've seen reviews saying the boss fights are easy, and I think it's because of the quality of the controls, not the difficulty. This guy spent some quality time on them.

At over 11 years old, this game's only sign of age is the lack of micro-transactions.

10 out of 10. Get it.

183824843.review: holy freaking crap dude! I used to watch my dad play this when I was very young, like 5 or 6 maybe, and this game made my imagination run fucking wild! I can see why, this game probably blew my tiny 5-year-old mind to bits! I played a bit a few months ago in casual mode, and I got some nostalgia then, and eventually got bored and stopped. I just beat the game, it was in normal mode, and I kinda sorta accidentally beat it all in one sitting. of course, I didn't get everything 100% complete, but I beat the game. my heart was POUNDING when I ran out of good healing items during the final boss. this game had a similar effect to me when I beat Undertale or Salt And Sanctuary, fucking love this game! I will hold this game in my heart, as few have done before it. with a combination of nostalgia and really cool gameplay and awesome story, I would ALWAYS recommend people play this game!

183614382.review:
I first played Dust on my family's Xbox 360 and was sad that I never got the chance to beat it before we put it away. Steam gave me a second chance, and now I'm farther than I was.
Gameplay: The hack-n-slash swordplay is good. Few combos, but that keeps the game in it's simplistic style, and they get the job done. Also Dust Storm + Fidget go brrrr. Platforming is clean & exploration is rewarded. Grind isn't required, and if you're good, healing items will be plentiful, especially the mysterious wall chicken :3c
Display: The artstyle is lovely, and the designs are great. The scenery encapsulates the mood perfectly, and the music is... well, music to my ears! The dialogue and voice acting is well done and can be pretty funny, especially the occasional 4th wall breaks. Characters are created quite well, and Fidget is my favorite. That is not the furry in me speaking, she was my favorite before I even knew furries were a thing. Dust and Ahrah are cool as well tho.
Story: The game immediately makes you ask questions, mainly about Dust and Ahrah. It very much creates a need to know more. My little 6-year-old brain didn't care for it at the time, but now I do.
Conclusion: If you're looking for a story-driven game and don't mind the simplistic gameplay, this is a great game for you. Worth the small-ish price, but definitely don't pass up on it during a sale.

183614020.review: This is one of those games that they just don't make anymore, I knew that the moment I saw the old Micro Soft logo and after some playing i can assure you, it's amazing. The combat flows incredibly smooth for it's age and the hand painted graphics are just amazing to look at with detail in every corner. Don't let the fact it was on the Xbox 360 fool you, this game is a high quality that goes beyond the ages. So if you're looking for a classic to play, this is one.

183589924.review:
Redescobrir esse jogo depois de tantos anos foi uma surpresa. Acho muito bom para quem curte metroidvania e arte anthro. As mecânicas são simples, o jogo é rápido, porém há mais coisas para quem curte completar tudo e desafios de combos, o que eu não curto.
A história é simples, mas muito legal. Porém poderia desenvolver mais ela e o mundo. O principal tem 2 acompanhantes, uma espada e uma Naavi, e seria muito bom conhecer mais da história deles, mas são as limitações de um jogo indie, e talvez o criador os tenha desenvolvido em conteúdos extra.

183572481.review:
This game means a lot to me.  Back on XBLA, it was the first real gaming challenge I took on.  I certainly took way more time to finish that playthrough when I was 7 years old, grinding for max level just to be able to beat it on tough as a kid.  I realize now if you're decent at games, the enemies you kill along the way give plenty of levels even on tough difficulty.  
It's not very long, I got all achievements in just under 14 hours on this playthrough.  The story, art, and voice acting are very good. 
My one complaint is the difficulty curve.  The game starts off fairly difficult (again, on the difficulty required for the achievement).  Save points only heal you to around 1/3 HP, so going into early boss fights you spend all your money on the healing you need.  This all changes once you unlock regen gear.  Regen gear heals you infinitely, albeit slowly.  The game becomes mostly trivial once you unlock even your first piece of regen gear, since you can spend gold upgrading yourself rather than on healing.  
This is a must-buy at its sale price of $4.
Design- 9/10
Gameplay- 7.5/10
Fun- 9/10
Overall score: 8.5/10
Bumping it up to a 9/10 though for nostalgia ;)

183537935.review: Um dos meus jogos favoritos da infância.
